results.title: George Bernard Shaw
results.creator_credit: Jan Read, Theodora Olembert and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: Using newsreel interviews and conversation with such people as Dame Sybil Thorndike and Kingsley Martin the film presents the personality of Shaw, the social critic whose plays cast a brilliant light on the political ideas struggling for expression at the turn of the century. Commentary by John van Eyssen and Tony Quinn.

results.title: A Geometry lesson
results.creator_credit: Virgilio Sabel, Carlo Ponti and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This Italian art film traces a relationship between the shapes of nature and the modern sculpture of the Henry Moore school. The film considers the geometrical lines of nature - the shapes and lines of the human body, the structure of crystals and the spiral lines of a snail’s shell - a combination of calculation and creative impulse. Art, by dint of instinct, approaches nature’s examples, thus widening the range of our eyes and our minds. (Award: Venice)

results.title: Geography of South America: the continent
results.brief_description: The main geographical features of South America, including the Andes, the Guiana and Brazilian highlands, and the Orinoco, Amazon and Plata-Parana River Basions. The relationships of these geographic factors to the people and their ways of life. Survey of agriculture, industry, commerce, cities and culture.

results.title: Geography of South America: Brazil
results.brief_description: The geographic features of Brazil and their relationship to such important crops as coffee, cotton and cacao; Brazil as a land of impenetrable jungle, fertile farmlands, gigantic plantations, rich mineral resources, thriving industry and big cities. Includes a sequence on Brasilia, the new capital.

results.title: Geography of South America: Argentina, Paraguay, Uraguay
results.brief_description: The geographic factors influencing the economy and life of Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, pointing out that the three nations of the Plata-Parana River system are rich in flat and rolling lands suitable for farming and grazing. Some of the achievements and problems of these countries are also discussed.

results.title: Geography of Australia
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the geography of Australia; surrounding oceans; its area, rainfall and wind systems resulting in various climatic regions, temperature variations; main mineral resources and the uses to which these resources are put; chief rural industries. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: The Gentleman in room 6
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, George K. Arthur and Meteor Films
results.brief_description: Short story film about a derelict and forgotten character hiding in a room womewhere in South America. he is confronted by three of his old associates, each of whom provides further clues to his identity which is revealed in the last few seconds of the film.

results.title: Gentle strangers
results.brief_description: A drama concerning a Thai girl who comes to Australia to study. Provides an insight into some of the problems faced by Asian students in our country.

results.title: The Gentle art of film projection
results.creator_credit: Donald Peters, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Some pointers on the art of film projection, told through the humorous story of a poor showman who lost his film audience because he didn’t know how to operate a 16mm projector. The moment that George Beesley appears on the scene we know something ridiculous is bound to happen—and it does! This sad sack merrily muddles through the film showing and annoys his audience so thoroughly that they walk out in disgust. An interested spectator then patiently explains the principles of efficient projection, while animated sequences demonstrate the construction of a projector, the preparation in advance of the room to be used for the showing, and the correct placement of screen and loudspeaker. Procedures for preventing damage to film and equipment are outlined. Animation by Wolf Koenig.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Peters, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Genetics and plant breeding
results.creator_credit: David Morphet, Peter Bradford, Unilever Films and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Mendel’s laws of inheritance, and how the passage of the dominant and recessive characteristics from one generation to another depends on discrete particles of matter, particles which are now known to be genes on the chromosomes in the cell nucleus. It shows how the principles of genetics are applied to produce new varieties of plants.
